greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{k = 0..n} (-1)^k * C(n,k) * C(2*n,k).
comment: For each n > 0, a(p-n) == 2^(2 - 3*n)*A252355(n) (mod p), for all primes p >= 2*n+1 [Chamberland, et al., Thm. 2.3]. - _L. Edson Jeffery_, Dec 17 2014
link: Marc Chamberland and Karl Dilcher, A Binomial Sum Related to Wolstenholme's Theorem, J. Number Theory, Vol. 171, Issue 11 (Nov. 2009), pp. 2659-2672.
formula: exp( Sum_{n >= 1} a(n)*x^n/n ) = 1 - x + 3*x^3 - 7*x^4 + 4*x^5 + 24*x^6 - 85*x^7 + 99*x^8 + 215*x^9 - 1196*x^10 + ... appears to have integer coefficients. - _Peter Bala_, Jan 04 2016
results.author: _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Dec 31 2013
